page.title: 01General Review Chaldon Hills
page.content: This block lies just inland from the South Dorset coast.An area of rolling countryside it has superb views from the hilltops of the surrounding area. A rural area,it is largely agricultural although in the South East corner there is,for these parts,a large cluster of buildings which forms the Royal Armoured Corps Gunnery School at Lulworth Camp. It is an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty with woodland,rough pasture and arable land. Only two roads can be found,both running North/South within the block.One skirts Marley Wood and leads to Daggers Gate,the other forms part of the road from the coast to Wool. Walking to other parts on footpaths and bridleways one is aware of an abundance of wildlife,which flourishes largely undisturbed.
